Through the "Green Delivery" delivery model, the Poste Italiane Group has made a proximity network available to the territory, which guarantees greater flexibility for customers and, at the same time, generates environmental benefits.

Poste Italiane customers, in fact, can make use of both the PuntoPoste network (consisting of more than 15,000 pick-up points such as tobacconists, bars, stationers, newsagents, Kipoint) and the Post Office network for the delivery of parcels.

This delivery model also allows for greater efficiency in Poste Italiane's logistics as more parcels can be delivered to a single collection point, thus limiting the number of pick-ups and fleet movements.

The journeys saved and kilometres avoided thanks to the Green Delivery model avoided the emission of 53 tonnes of CO2 and 244 kg of air pollutants into the atmosphere (i.e. COVNM, NH3, SOx, NOx, PM10, PM2.5).
In particular, each parcel delivered through the Green delivery model resulted in a saving in CO2 emissions and air contaminants of approximately 5.3 grams.
